Correction Narrative: The operation's LCCA submitted via email the operation's Corrective Action indicating that Operation will continue to maintain appropriate supplies in the 1st aid kit.

Correction Narrative: The operation's LCCA submitted via email the operation's Corrective Action indicating that the Operation has amended the schedule to show that youth are provided recreation activities beyond expectation.

Correction Narrative: The bedroom windows have been securely fastened by screwing them in to ensure they remain closed and stable. To further address pest concerns, bug repellent was applied around the window arears to deter insect entry.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was cited for this standard during the last HM inspection on 4-2-25. Correction Narrative: During the follow up by inspection at the facility today, it was observed that the damaged couch, cabinet in the restroom, and stairs rails have been repaired.

Deficiency Narrative: The advance 2 weeks notice to the DFPS staff regarding initial service planning meeting was missing in the childs file.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided corrections indicating they have them sign at admission that they have been given the CPOS meeting information. Will continue this and admin will monitor. We weren't out of compliance so there was no correction.

Deficiency Narrative: One child initial service plan was missing the names of the participants.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided its written correction via email. In its correction, the operation stated that the names were present, and signatures were present where the document requested. The inspector suggested to print the names (there is no area for this) and TRIE, II staff will ensure our spaces have both signature and printed names.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough of the facility, one of the couch in the living room area was observed not to be in good repair condition. The chair is very uncomfortable and you can feel the spring when you seat on it. One cabinet was also observed to be damaged in the restroom.

During the review of a childs file, multiple dates of birth were noticed. The date of birth in the intake form, the binder cover and placement summary says 9 years while the discipline notification form for the child says child is 10 years.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided the following corrections indicating that they will change the data or info that the CW writes on our documentation to reflect what is on their paperwork. All staff can monitor and review. We simply crossed out his info and wrote other age.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not have an annual evaluation for review.
Correction Narrative:
12/09/2024- The operation's LCAA submitted to licensing staff via email the operation's Corrective Action Plan. The operation's LCCA provided communication indicating the operation has not experienced any Emergency Behavior Intervention incidents during the year of 2024.  

Additionally, the operation's LCCA credited the operation's low incidents due to utilizing de-escalation techniques as well as encouraging positive behaviors. Also, the LCCA indicated de-escalation is utilized on a frequent basis by staff through implementation of SAMA.

The LCCA emphasized staff utilizing separation technique when residents are experiencing issues with positive interaction.

Deficiency Narrative: A child received their 72-Hour Health Screening late.
Correction Narrative:
12/24/2024-The operation's LCCA submitted to licensing staff via email the operation's Corrective Action Plan.  The operation's LCCA provided communication indicating the operation will continue to follow policies as related to medical and dental ensuring each child receiving emergency care services receive a health screening or EPSDT examination within 72 hours after admission as implemented by the LCCA.

Additionally, the LCCA communicated the youth was taken to ER prior to 3-Day Medical Exam as well as the operation has requested documentation but has been unsuccessful in obtaining documentation. The LCCA reported the youth was taken to subsequent medical appointments as well.

Deficiency Narrative: A child exhibited warning signs of suicide, and no documentation of a risk assessment was conducted.
Correction Narrative:
12/18/2024-The operation's LCCA submitted to licensing staff via email the operation's Corrective Action Plan.  The operation's LCCA provided communication indicating Suicide Screening will continue to be implemented per Minimum Standards to include the moment a youth is suicidal.  This includes additional screenings when youth verbalize self-harm.  The operation practices identifying risk factors (including ASQ) and protective factors, conducting a suicide inquiry, determining risk level and interventions, and documenting a treatment plan when warranted.  The Suicide Prevention line offers support and suggestions which the operation utilizes at present.  Assessment at a MH facility is also current practice and youth are taken when they meet criteria (critical school assessments, have a plan, verbalize needing to go, physical attempts, etc.)

12/04/2024- The operation's LCAA submitted to licensing staff via email the operation's Corrective Action Plan. The operation's LCCA provided communication indicating the operation Suicidal Screenings will continue to be completed, including immediately when a youth verbalizes it.

Deficiency Narrative: The freezer in the garage contained food items. There was no thermometer located inside the freezer to obtain a temperature reading.
Correction Narrative: 12/09/2024-The operation's LCAA submitted to licensing staff via email the operation's Corrective Action Plan. The operation's LCCA provided a photograph displaying a freezer thermometer measuring the temperature of the air (appropriate temperature reading) in the deep freezer demonstrating compliance in accordance with Minimum Standards.

Deficiency Narrative: The 2nd. Quarter EBI Report has not been submitted to Child Care Regulation.
Correction Narrative: The operation's 2nd. Quarterly EBI Report was submitted into the system.  The report was reviewed in CLASS.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on information gathered during the investigation, it was determined a staff member did not provide appropriate supervision resulting in an adolescent running away.
The fire extinguisher located in the kitchen, although still current on inspection, indicates empty (lost pressure) and needs to be refilled or replaced.
Correction Narrative:
07/30/2024-The LCCA submitted to licensing staff via email the operation's Corrective Action Plan indicating fire extinguisher was within timeframe for regulations with expiration date of August 2024.  Per Houston Fire, there was no solid rationale as to why the unit moved into red; however, it could have been due to the heat while staff and residents were displaced during Hurricane Beryl as reported by the operation's LCCA.  Additionally, the operation's LCCA reported the unit has been replaced as well as the other unit was retagged for the year.

07/31/2024-The LCCA submitted to licensing staff via email the photographs of the operation's two fire extinguishers (one new as well as one serviced) presenting in green indicating full as well as tags indicating service dates of July 2024.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on information gathered during a review of the operation's documents, it was found two out two children's Discharge Summaries did not contain the reason medication was prescribed.
Correction Narrative: 05/16/2024- The operation's LCAA submitted to licensing staff via email the operation's Corrective Action Plan. The operation's LCCA provided communication indicating discharge summaries will be reviewed to ensure all required content is included in future discharge summaries.

Allegation: No CPOS for a youth. 
Follow up-There was a CPOS dated for Aug 2022. Will AR
The Residence by Infinity Elite, II"
